sub_title: Entrepreneur and CEO at Lamoral Coatings
summary:
International Marketing and Business Executive
Subject: senior executive leadership 

Highly experienced international executive with 25 years career in global material sciences, industrial and chemical industries- strategic planning, culture change, effective people management, portfolio transformations, turnaround, P&L responsibility, startups, entrepreneurial, partnerships and joint ventures.

Before Theo Verweerden founded Lamoral Coatings he held the position of Executive Marketing Director at DSM Corporate.  He started his career in 1992 in production and engineering in Morton International. In the years thereafter he moved to business and marketing roles with increased responsibilities. Before joining DSM Theo worked till 2008 as global marketing director with Rohm and Haas.  Theo holds a MsC degree in chemical engineering (TUE) , a bachelor degree in business management (UU)  and MBA certificates with Wharton, IMD and St. Gallen business schools.  

Career highlights: 

* Entrepreneur: Founded the start up Lamoral Coatings  (clean tech technology). Defining and entering  industry applications. Keeping materials as they are by durable technology. 

• Business and M&S leadership at DSM and R&H: assessed, ignited, instilled and implemented M&S capabilities, managed the M&S function and changed a highly complex and diversified organization from product centric to become customer centric leading to 100 MM Euro EBIT improvement. 

• Led the corporate strategic dialogue at DSM  with the managing board in the sustainability work stream. Industry leadership supported by top ranking DSM in the Dow Jones sustainability index.  
* Societal leadership: leading sustainability programs, setting up venture AIF in Rwanda-Africa in partnership with World Food Program and Clinton Health Access Initiative and driving the sustainability program in DSM. Recently DSM is ranked #2 at Fortunes “Change the world list” referring to my project.
